header.description: This plug-in includes steps to work with IBM API Connect when developing and publishing APIs and LoopBack applications.

step-type.name: Login
step-type.description: Authenticate with an API Connect cloud through the management server. This step is a prerequisite for all other steps in the IBM API Connect plug-in.

property-ui.label: Server
property-ui.description: Specify the API Connect management server endpoint to authenticate with. For example, the IBM Bluemix endpoint is us.apiconnect.ibmcloud.com.

property-ui.label: Username
property-ui.description: User name to use to authenticate with the API Connect management server.

property-ui.label: Password
property-ui.description: Password to use to authenticate with the API Connect management server.

property-ui.label: APIC Tool Path
property-ui.description: The full path to the apic command-line tool. For example: C:\Users\John\AppData\Roaming\npm\apic.cmd

step-type.name: Logout
step-type.description: Remove local authentication credentials for an API Connect cloud. Run this step at the end of each deployment process.

property-ui.label: Server
property-ui.description: Specify the API Connect management server endpoint to remove credentials from. For example, the IBM Bluemix endpoint is us.apiconnect.ibmcloud.com.

property-ui.label: APIC Tool Path
property-ui.description: The full path to the apic command-line tool. For example: C:\Users\John\AppData\Roaming\npm\apic.cmd

step-type.name: Push API Product Definitions to Drafts
step-type.description: Push API product definitions to drafts on an API Connect cloud.

property-ui.label: Server
property-ui.description: Specify the management server endpoint to push to. For example, the IBM Bluemix endpoint is us.apiconnect.ibmcloud.com.

property-ui.label: Organization
property-ui.description: Provider organization name.

property-ui.label: API Product Definitions
property-ui.description: The full path to a YAML file that contains the API product definitions. Example: 'banking-services.yaml'.

property-ui.label: Replace Named Version
property-ui.description: Specify the name and version of a definition to replace. Use the following format: Name:Version. For example: climbon:1.0.0

property-ui.label: Product Only
property-ui.description: Select to push the product only, and not the referenced APIs.

property-ui.label: APIC Tool Path
property-ui.description: The full path to the apic command-line tool. For example: C:\Users\John\AppData\Roaming\npm\apic.cmd

step-type.name: Publish API Product Definitions
step-type.description: Publish API product and referenced APIs to a catalog.

property-ui.label: Server
property-ui.description: Specify the management server endpoint to publish to. For example, the IBM Bluemix endpoint is us.apiconnect.ibmcloud.com.

property-ui.label: Organization
property-ui.description: Provider organization name.

property-ui.label: Catalog
property-ui.description: The name of the catalog to deploy to.

property-ui.label: API Product Definitions
property-ui.description: The full path to a YAML file that contains the API or product definitions.

property-ui.label: Stage Status
property-ui.description: Select to leave the product in the staged state, instead of moving to the published state.

property-ui.label: APIC Tool Path
property-ui.description: The full path to the apic command-line tool. For example: C:\Users\John\AppData\Roaming\npm\apic.cmd

step-type.name: Publish an Application
step-type.description: Publish a Node.js (LoopBack) application to a provider application.

property-ui.label: Server
property-ui.description: Specify the management server endpoint to publish to. For example, the IBM Bluemix endpoint is us.apiconnect.ibmcloud.com.

property-ui.label: Organization
property-ui.description: Provider organization name.

property-ui.label: Loopback Application
property-ui.description: LoopBack application name.

property-ui.label: Loopback Project Directory
property-ui.description: The full path to the directory that contains the LoopBack application.

property-ui.label: APIC Tool Path
property-ui.description: The full path to the apic command-line tool. For example: C:\Users\John\AppData\Roaming\npm\apic.cmd

step-type.name: Set Configuration Variable
step-type.description: Set a configuration variable. You do not need to run the Login step before running this step. This is a wrapper step for the App and Catalog Identifier. If you have access to the Identifier, run that command through the Shell step.

property-ui.label: Server
property-ui.description: Specify the management server endpoint to set the variable on. For example, the IBM Bluemix endpoint is us.apiconnect.ibmcloud.com.

property-ui.label: Organization
property-ui.description: Provider organization name.

property-ui.label: Config Variable Type
property-ui.description: Select the type of variable to configure.

property-ui.label: App or Catalog Name
property-ui.description: Specify a name of an application or catalog to configure.

property-ui.label: Local
property-ui.description: Select to set the local application configuration variable.

property-ui.label: Global
property-ui.description: Select to set the global configuration variable.

property-ui.label: APIC Tool Path
property-ui.description: The full path to the apic command-line tool. For example: C:\Users\John\AppData\Roaming\npm\apic.cmd
